intro: Amblyanthera mexicana var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which provide a distinct appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a variety of colors ranging from white to pink. This species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
